page.title: 14RELIGION IN EGERTON
page.content: There are three religious centres in the village, two methodist chapels, the Unitarian Chapel, Dimple,which dates from 1713, and Egerton United Reform, which opened in 1873, and the Church of England, Christ Church, Walmsley. There is a Roman Catholic Church a mile away.The methodist chapels are in the northern section of the village, and have small but loyal congregations. Christ Church has a large and regular congration, and a resident vicar who is also the Rural Dean of Walmsley. Christ Church originated in the 1600's in the northern section of the village, but was rebuilt in the southern section in 1839, as the mills opened. 36% of residents regularly attend church, with 73% of adults being C.E., 11%,R.C.,8% methodist,8% non-believers.
